title: Name that picture
post:
Ariel Agemian (Knight of St. Gregory) 1904-1963. Remarkably, painted in 1935, before even the Enrie photos. See Shroudstory Dec 11, 2011.
Often copied, so this particular one may not be original.
author: Hugh Farey

title: Name that picture
post: It is not the Original art created by Agemian.
author: Giorgio

title: Name that picture
post: This is definitely NOT the painting by Ariel Agemian, although it could be a copy of his work made by someone else.
author: Barrie Schwortz

title: Name that picture
post: For God’s sake, to identify this painting as the one by Ariel Agemian is to be cockeyed.
author: Louis

title: Name that picture
post: “…the one by Ariel Agemian…” Did he only paint one? There are several differences between this and the one most often reproduced on the internet, but it has an obvious resemblance, don’t you think?
author: Hugh Farey

title: Name that picture
post:
“…the one by Ariel Agemian…” Did he only paint one? There are several differences between this and the one most often reproduced on the internet, but it has an obvious resemblance, don’t you think?
Only if you consider (all of)  the Vignon markings :)
author: Kelly Kearse

title: Name that picture
post: As far as I know the Armenian-American artist painted just one image, the others which look similar in some ways were based on this. It is not possible to confuse the original with the imitations.  There are many TS and Aggemian overlapped images on the Internet, in fact one such image was even “produced” by Sai Baba, in India, to show what Jesus looked like!
author: Louis

title: Name that picture
post: This is in fact the so-called Sai Baba image. It has been on the internet for years.
author: Barrie Schwortz

title: Name that picture
post:
That’s funny, he seems to have “materialised” the computer-produced image like the one in the link below, on Pinterest.
My intererest in Sai Baba began while doing a course in Parapsychology. He had been challenged by Dr. Abraham Kovoor, of Sri Lanka. Some time after that my professor of paraspsychology also challenged him to perform a miracle in his front, but under scientific control.
All he had to was to fill a cavity, and there could be nothing more than a gesture, or he could just utter a word, to make it more Jesus-like. The material could be obtained beforehand with a dentist.
The challenge was of course ignored. Well, so we have the “miracle man” and his computer-produced Jesus image:
https://images.search.yahoo.com/images/view;_ylt=AwrTcXyXW3pTf1QAi42JzbkF;_ylu=X3oDMTIzM24xZWJsBHNlYwNzcgRzbGsDaW1nBG9pZAMzMmU0N2YxMjIwZWQyOThhNTgwZjBiMzRkYzcyMWM4ZgRncG9zAzI3BGl0A2Jpbmc-?back=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.search.yahoo.com%2Fsearch%2Fimages%3Fp%3Dsai%2Bbaba%2527s%2Bjesus%26ei%3Dutf-8%26y%3DSearch%26fr%3Dsfp-img%26tab%3Dorganic%26ri%3D27&w=398&h=600&imgurl=www.flixya.com%2Ffiles-photo%2Fg%2Ff%2Fb%2Fgfbhawalpore-2254904.jpg&rurl=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.flixya.com%2Fphoto%2F2254904%2FJESUS-FACE-MIRACLE-PICTURE-SATHYA-SAI-BABA-REAL-JESUS-PHOTO-gfb&size=77.6KB&name=%3Cb%3EJESUS+%3C%2Fb%3EFACE+MIRACLE+PICTURE-SATHYA+%3Cb%3ESAI+BABA%3C%2Fb%3E-REAL+%3Cb%3EJESUS%3C%2Fb%3E-PHOTO-gfb.&p=sai+baba%27s+jesus&oid=32e47f1220ed298a580f0b34dc721c8f&fr2=&fr=sfp-img&tt=%3Cb%3EJESUS+%3C%2Fb%3EFACE+MIRACLE+PICTURE-SATHYA+%3Cb%3ESAI+BABA%3C%2Fb%3E-REAL+%3Cb%3EJESUS%3C%2Fb%3E-PHOTO-gfb.&b=0&ni=128&no=27&ts=&tab=organic&sigr=133mteqgg&sigb=13h1svpsd&sigi=11p734dqn&sigt=12ld5dc60&sign=12ld5dc60&.crumb=cW/uZ1wtYMm&fr=sfp-img
author: Louis

title: Name that picture
post: Here is a link to the website of Annig Raley-Agemian, the daughter of Ariel Agemian, that honors her father’s work:  http://www.agemianpaintings.com/
author: Barrie Schwortz

title: Name that picture
post:
I emailed Annig Raley, who simply sent me a Google images search page of “agemian paintings” saying “This is the portrait of Christ which my father painted. I hope this info helps you.” I think she means “these” as there are a few, but none of them is the disputed one.
On the other hand the image above is also certainly not the Sai Baba image, which in fact resembles the Ariel Agemian image rather more than it resembles the painting above, although, like the painting above, it is often overlaid by a shoud transparency.
After burrowing about, I might suggest Heinrich Hofmann (1824-1911), whose paintings of Christ resemble the one above quite closely, although I cannot find an exact copy.
author: Hugh Farey

title: Name that picture
post:
So if I am mistaken, please show me the real Satya Baba image, the one which he is said to have “manifested”. Some searching brought a Agemian-TS overlay:
http://www.exbaba.com/articles/faceofjesus.html
There is also a Jesus sketch, but in this case nothing is said about Sai Baba:
http://www.exbaba.com/articles/faceofjesus.html
As Jesus is an “Avatar”, incarnation of God, in Hinduism and there are many Hindu temples with images and even sculptures of Jesus, it seems that he wanted to get a “real” Jesus face and therefore TS/Agemian.
author: Louis

title: Name that picture
post:
There is also a sketch, but no link to Sai Baba
http://sathyasaibaba.files.wordpress.com/2008/07/jesus-light.jpgl
author: Louis

title: Name that picture
post:

title: Name that picture
post:
Here is the painting by Heinrich Hoffmann, which cannot be linked either to the TS or Aggemian:
